Aluminum 6061-T6.material_notes: A general purpose, heat treatable aluminum alloy with good formability, weldability, and corrosion resistance.
Aluminum 6061-T6.sustainability_notes: Highly recyclable, but initial production is energy-intensive.

Aluminum 7075-T6.material_notes: High-strength aluminum alloy widely used in aerospace and military applications.
Aluminum 7075-T6.sustainability_notes: High strength-to-weight ratio extends product life, but energy-intensive production.

Aluminum 2024-T3.material_notes: High-strength aluminum alloy used in aircraft structures.
Aluminum 2024-T3.sustainability_notes: Excellent for lightweighting in aerospace, but copper content reduces recyclability.

Aluminum 5052-H32.material_notes: Marine-grade aluminum with excellent corrosion resistance.
Aluminum 5052-H32.sustainability_notes: Excellent corrosion resistance extends service life in harsh environments.

Stainless Steel 304.material_notes: The most widely used stainless steel, offering excellent corrosion resistance and formability.
Stainless Steel 304.sustainability_notes: Highly durable and 100% recyclable. Can be recycled indefinitely.

Stainless Steel 316.material_notes: Marine-grade stainless steel with superior corrosion resistance, especially against chlorides.
Stainless Steel 316.sustainability_notes: Excellent longevity in marine environments reduces replacement frequency.

Stainless Steel 17-4 PH.material_notes: Precipitation-hardening stainless steel offering high strength and good corrosion resistance.
Stainless Steel 17-4 PH.sustainability_notes: High strength allows for lighter designs, but heat treatment is energy-intensive.

Stainless Steel 410.material_notes: Martensitic stainless steel with good corrosion resistance and high strength.
Stainless Steel 410.sustainability_notes: Good for high-wear applications, extending component life.

Carbon Steel 1045.material_notes: Medium carbon steel with good balance of strength, toughness, and wear resistance.
Carbon Steel 1045.sustainability_notes: Widely recyclable, but iron ore extraction has environmental impact.

Carbon Steel 4140.material_notes: Chromium-molybdenum alloy steel with high fatigue strength and toughness.
Carbon Steel 4140.sustainability_notes: Alloy content improves performance but complicates recycling.

Carbon Steel A36.material_notes: Structural steel commonly used in construction and bridges.
Carbon Steel A36.sustainability_notes: Most recycled material on earth. Steel industry has high recycling rates.

Tool Steel D2.material_notes: High-carbon, high-chromium tool steel with excellent wear resistance.
Tool Steel D2.sustainability_notes: Long tool life reduces replacement frequency, but production is energy-intensive.

Tool Steel O1.material_notes: Oil-hardening tool steel with good wear resistance and machinability.
Tool Steel O1.sustainability_notes: Oil quenching uses fossil fuels, but excellent durability.

Titanium Ti-6Al-4V (Grade 5).material_notes: The most common titanium alloy, known for its high strength-to-weight ratio and corrosion resistance.
Titanium Ti-6Al-4V (Grade 5).sustainability_notes: Very durable and long-lasting, reducing replacement needs, but extraction and processing require significant energy.

Titanium Grade 2 (CP Ti).material_notes: Commercially pure titanium with excellent corrosion resistance and good formability.
Titanium Grade 2 (CP Ti).sustainability_notes: Exceptional corrosion resistance means decades of service life.

Titanium Grade 5 (Ti-6Al-4V ELI).material_notes: Extra-low interstitial variant with improved ductility and fracture toughness.
Titanium Grade 5 (Ti-6Al-4V ELI).sustainability_notes: Medical-grade quality ensures biocompatibility and long implant life.

Inconel 718.material_notes: A precipitation-hardenable nickel-chromium superalloy characterized by high strength, high temperature resistance, and corrosion resistance.
Inconel 718.sustainability_notes: Extremely durable and long-lasting, but nickel mining has significant environmental impact.

Inconel 625.material_notes: Nickel-chromium superalloy with excellent corrosion and oxidation resistance.
Inconel 625.sustainability_notes: Exceptional durability in harsh chemical environments.

Hastelloy C-276.material_notes: Nickel-molybdenum-chromium alloy with excellent corrosion resistance in severe environments.
Hastelloy C-276.sustainability_notes: Extreme durability in corrosive environments, but expensive and energy-intensive.

Copper C110 (Electrolytic Tough Pitch).material_notes: High-purity copper with excellent electrical and thermal conductivity.
Copper C110 (Electrolytic Tough Pitch).sustainability_notes: Highly recyclable with no loss of quality. Copper recycling industry is well-established.

Brass C360.sustainability_notes: Excellent machinability reduces waste. Highly recyclable.

Bronze (Phosphor Bronze).material_notes: Copper-tin-phosphorus alloy with good corrosion resistance, fatigue resistance, and low friction.
Bronze (Phosphor Bronze).sustainability_notes: Excellent spring properties extend service life. Recyclable.

Beryllium Copper (C17200).material_notes: A high-strength copper-based alloy that offers a unique combination of high strength, hardness, conductivity, and corrosion resistance.
Beryllium Copper (C17200).sustainability_notes: Beryllium mining and dust are hazardous; high recyclability value.

Magnesium AZ31B.material_notes: Lightweight structural magnesium alloy with good room-temperature strength.
Magnesium AZ31B.sustainability_notes: Lightest structural metal, but extraction is energy-intensive.

Zinc Alloy (Zamak 3).material_notes: Die-casting alloy with good strength and excellent castability.
Zinc Alloy (Zamak 3).sustainability_notes: Low melting point reduces casting energy. Recyclable.

Lead.material_notes: Dense, soft metal with excellent radiation shielding and sound damping properties.
Lead.sustainability_notes: Toxic material with environmental concerns. Use declining due to health regulations.

Tungsten.material_notes: Refractory metal with highest melting point of all elements, used in high-temperature applications.
Tungsten.sustainability_notes: Extremely long tool life, but mining has environmental impact.

Molybdenum.material_notes: Refractory metal with high melting point and good thermal conductivity.

ABS Plastic, General Purpose.material_notes: A common thermoplastic polymer known for its impact resistance and toughness.
ABS Plastic, General Purpose.sustainability_notes: Petroleum-based and less commonly recycled than other plastics like PET.

Polycarbonate (PC).material_notes: Tough, transparent thermoplastic with excellent impact resistance.
Polycarbonate (PC).sustainability_notes: Recyclable but often not recycled due to contamination.

Nylon 6/6 (PA66).material_notes: Engineering thermoplastic with good mechanical properties, wear resistance, and low friction.
Nylon 6/6 (PA66).sustainability_notes: Derived from petroleum. Nylon recycling infrastructure is growing.

Delrin (Acetal/POM).material_notes: Engineering plastic known for high stiffness, low friction, and excellent dimensional stability.
Delrin (Acetal/POM).sustainability_notes: Excellent wear resistance extends part life, but not easily recyclable.

PTFE (Teflon).material_notes: Fluoropolymer with exceptional chemical resistance, low friction, and high temperature stability.
PTFE (Teflon).sustainability_notes: Extremely durable but production involves PFAS chemicals with environmental concerns.

PEEK (Polyether Ether Ketone).material_notes: A high-performance thermoplastic known for its excellent mechanical properties, chemical resistance, and high-temperature stability.
PEEK (Polyether Ether Ketone).sustainability_notes: High-performance thermoplastic, recyclable but energy-intensive to produce.

Polyethylene (HDPE).material_notes: High-density polyethylene with good chemical resistance and impact strength.
Polyethylene (HDPE).sustainability_notes: One of the most recycled plastics. Recycling code #2.

Polypropylene (PP).material_notes: Versatile thermoplastic with good chemical resistance and fatigue resistance.

PVC (Polyvinyl Chloride).material_notes: Common thermoplastic used in construction, piping, and electrical insulation.
PVC (Polyvinyl Chloride).sustainability_notes: Chlorine content raises environmental concerns. Recycling is challenging.

PET (Polyethylene Terephthalate).material_notes: Engineering thermoplastic used in bottles, fibers, and films.
PET (Polyethylene Terephthalate).sustainability_notes: Most recycled plastic globally. Recycling code #1.

Ultem (PEI).material_notes: High-performance thermoplastic with excellent thermal and mechanical properties.
Ultem (PEI).sustainability_notes: Excellent high-temperature performance extends component life.

Polystyrene (PS).material_notes: Rigid, clear plastic with good dimensional stability.
Polystyrene (PS).sustainability_notes: Difficult to recycle. Often ends up in landfills.

Acrylic (PMMA).material_notes: Transparent thermoplastic with excellent optical clarity and weather resistance.
Acrylic (PMMA).sustainability_notes: Recyclable but often incinerated for energy recovery.

Silicone Rubber, General Purpose.material_notes: A highly versatile elastomer known for its wide service temperature range, flexibility, and resistance to UV, ozone, and moisture.
Silicone Rubber, General Purpose.sustainability_notes: More durable and longer-lasting than many other rubbers, but not easily biodegradable or recycled.

Nitrile Rubber (NBR).material_notes: Synthetic rubber with excellent oil and fuel resistance.

EPDM Rubber.material_notes: Synthetic rubber with excellent weather, ozone, and UV resistance.
EPDM Rubber.sustainability_notes: Good outdoor durability extends service life.

Viton (FKM).material_notes: Fluoroelastomer with exceptional chemical and heat resistance.
Viton (FKM).sustainability_notes: Contains fluorine with environmental concerns. Extremely durable.

Natural Rubber.material_notes: Natural polymer from rubber trees with excellent elasticity and tear resistance.

G-10/FR-4 Glass Epoxy Composite.material_notes: A high-pressure thermoset laminate of woven fiberglass and epoxy resin, valued for its high strength, low moisture absorption, and excellent electrical insulating properties.
G-10/FR-4 Glass Epoxy Composite.sustainability_notes: Thermoset composite, not recyclable and difficult to dispose of.

Carbon Fiber Composite (Epoxy).material_notes: High-performance composite with exceptional strength-to-weight ratio.
Carbon Fiber Composite (Epoxy).sustainability_notes: Energy-intensive production but enables lightweight designs. Recycling is difficult.

Fiberglass (Polyester).material_notes: Glass-reinforced plastic with good strength and corrosion resistance.
Fiberglass (Polyester).sustainability_notes: Thermoset material is difficult to recycle.

Kevlar (Aramid Fiber).material_notes: High-strength synthetic fiber used in bulletproof vests and composite materials.
Kevlar (Aramid Fiber).sustainability_notes: Extremely strong and durable, extending product life.

Ceramic (Alumina Al2O3).material_notes: High-purity ceramic with excellent hardness, wear resistance, and electrical insulation.
Ceramic (Alumina Al2O3).sustainability_notes: Abundant raw materials. Very long service life.

Silicon Carbide (SiC).material_notes: Advanced ceramic with exceptional hardness and thermal shock resistance.
Silicon Carbide (SiC).sustainability_notes: Extreme durability extends tool life, but production is energy-intensive.

Zirconia (ZrO2).material_notes: Advanced ceramic with high fracture toughness and wear resistance.
Zirconia (ZrO2).sustainability_notes: Biocompatible and extremely durable for medical applications.

Silicon Nitride (Si3N4).material_notes: Advanced ceramic with excellent thermal shock resistance and high-temperature strength.
Silicon Nitride (Si3N4).sustainability_notes: Excellent for high-temperature applications extending equipment life.

Glass (Borosilicate).material_notes: Heat-resistant glass with low thermal expansion, used in laboratory equipment.
Glass (Borosilicate).sustainability_notes: Infinitely recyclable. Made from abundant raw materials.

Soda-Lime Glass.material_notes: Most common type of glass used in windows and bottles.
Soda-Lime Glass.sustainability_notes: Most recycled material after steel. 100% recyclable.

Concrete (Structural).material_notes: Composite material widely used in construction with good compressive strength.
Concrete (Structural).sustainability_notes: Cement production is a major CO2 source. Durable and long-lasting.

Wood (Oak).material_notes: Hardwood with good strength and attractive grain pattern.
Wood (Oak).sustainability_notes: Renewable resource when sustainably harvested. Carbon sink.

Wood (Pine).material_notes: Softwood widely used in construction and furniture.
Wood (Pine).sustainability_notes: Fast-growing renewable resource. Carbon negative when sustainably managed.

Bamboo.material_notes: Fast-growing grass with excellent strength-to-weight ratio.
Bamboo.sustainability_notes: Fastest-growing plant. Renewably harvested every 3-5 years.

Graphite.material_notes: Carbon material with excellent thermal and electrical conductivity, used in electrodes and lubricants.
Graphite.sustainability_notes: Mining has environmental impact, but material is very stable and long-lasting.

Nickel 200.material_notes: Commercially pure nickel with excellent corrosion resistance.
Nickel 200.sustainability_notes: Excellent corrosion resistance extends equipment life.

Monel 400.material_notes: Nickel-copper alloy with excellent corrosion resistance in marine environments.
Monel 400.sustainability_notes: Exceptional marine corrosion resistance extends service life.

Cast Iron (Gray).material_notes: Economical casting material with good machinability and vibration damping.
Cast Iron (Gray).sustainability_notes: Highly recyclable. Cast iron recycling is well-established.

Cast Iron (Ductile).material_notes: Cast iron with improved ductility and impact resistance.
Cast Iron (Ductile).sustainability_notes: Good strength and ductility extend component life.

Cobalt-Chrome (CoCr).material_notes: Biocompatible alloy with excellent wear resistance.
Cobalt-Chrome (CoCr).sustainability_notes: Medical-grade material with decades-long implant life.

Tantalum.material_notes: Highly corrosion-resistant refractory metal with excellent biocompatibility.
Tantalum.sustainability_notes: Rare metal with mining concerns, but exceptional durability.

Niobium.material_notes: Superconducting metal used in high-field magnets and aerospace.

Zirconium.material_notes: Excellent corrosion resistance in most acids and alkalis.
Zirconium.sustainability_notes: Exceptional corrosion resistance in chemical processing.

Platinum.material_notes: Noble metal with excellent corrosion resistance and catalytic properties.
Platinum.sustainability_notes: Recyclable and reusable. Mining has environmental impact.

Gold.material_notes: Highly conductive and corrosion-resistant precious metal.
Gold.sustainability_notes: Highly recyclable. Most gold ever mined is still in use.

Silver.material_notes: Best electrical and thermal conductor of all metals.
Silver.sustainability_notes: Recyclable. Used in solar panels supporting renewable energy.
